author: ondapc
title: Global ADA lottery
description: Every country has their own lottery system - some are more popular than others; most of them engage their users to weekly or daily drawings.

f6_assessments.q0: Having a global lottery with big prizes in ADA is something that could lead to some exposure among the people who don't know about crypto. But many of those who do, but chose not to interact with any kind of blockchain is because they view it as a pyramid scheme, and news of this "Huge international lottery with prizes in this crypto currency" will become just another validation of their conviction.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has stated that (s)he worked in the past with lottery application, but has not provided any type of proof. Besides this missing info, the proposal would be hard to assess considering that at this stage, it looks more like an advertisement concept, since it contains no detailed plan whatsoever, no description of required resources, personnel, timeline or a detailed budget.
f6_assessments.q2: As stated in the above assessment, the proposal contains no details about how it would be implemented if successfully funded. In which countries will the lottery system take place, how many people are needed to start the implementation, what will the budget of $8000 be used for? Are the prizes included in this budget? How will the lottery be marketed? If the proposer wishes to implement this proposal, I suggest a resubmission to a future fund with all these and many more other missing details added.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal does not make it clear what the problem is. From the statement I can infer that it is the lack of a lottery system at Cardano but it was not clear to me why this is a problem and how a global ADA lottery would add value to Cardano's ecosystem. Furthermore, I do not understand how this proposal contemplates the challenge of motivating non-English speakers to learn and grow Cardano ecosystem. Key metrics and goals of the proposal were not presented.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer did not present any evidence of its experience with lottery applications. Thus, it is not possible to assess whether it will be able to implement the proposed work. The budget has not been detailed so it is not possible to assess whether it is reasonable to achieve the goals. The proposer does not have a deadline for completion of the work. Nor is there a conductible plan showing what will be done and how it will be done. The resources needed to implement the proposal are not described. The proposal does not specify how many people will be needed to implement the work.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal did not present the information necessary to audit the progress and success of the proposal. It is important that a roadmap is presented with milestones, a deadline for completion of the project and metrics or KPIs to assess the success of the proposal. Furthermore, the target problem was not clearly presented.

f6_assessments.q0: As Multilingual Resources Challenge wants to motivate non english speakers to learn and grow Cardano ecosystem in the next 3-6 months, this proposal clearly not in the right section. Author of the ADA lottery idea can submit this proposal in DApps & Integrations' challenge or Mini/Low-Budget Dapps & Integrations challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Actually this idea for lottery dApps will be great if implemented on Cardano ecosystem, since the other blockchain have the lottery/gambling dApps and we have not. It will attract more user to try Cardano ecosystem. I would suggest you to try sharing your idea to community first, connect with members then build a team. Then if author already brainstorming with team members, the $8,000 budget can be detailed down so next community advisors can assess the budget too.
f6_assessments.q2: Since the proposal are not yet explained in detail and submitted in a wrong challenge, the key metrics and success criteria can not be audit by public.

f6_assessments.q0: Promoting Cardano globally by creating a lottery and getting paid in ADA to gain global attention is an idea that does not benefit Cardano and the Cardano community. Because if we create a lottery platform and let everyone know about Cardano through that lottery platform, the community will think Cardano is just a blockchain platform used to do lottery and give money to others. lucky way. But this is not a solution that can change many things in this world. Therefore, I really don't like the idea. Because not only is it not beneficial to promote Cardano too much, but it also misunderstands the direction and mission of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
"Proposer claims that he/she having worked with lottery applications. But how long? What is the position of the proposer in that job? Proposer has not yet provided any evidence for that claim. Besides, to implement this idea on the blockchain platform, the proposal needs more people with experience in the blockchain platform and blockchain developers.
Not giving a specific plan is also one of the things that makes this proposal unfeasible"
f6_assessments.q2: There are no deliverables or timelines thus it is not possible to audit this proposal. Nothing has been stated about how it meets the challenge of any metrics for measuring the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
At the first glance, the proposal doesn't identifie problem within the challenge which needs to be solved but actually it could make a sense of community around to have conversations talk with throughout building the new branded name of the largest lottery on the planet as the ambition of the Author. But anyway, this proposal seems to be more suitable in the challenges: "Catalyst Natives COTI: Pay with ADA Plug-in" or "DApps & Integrations".
In general, the proposal clearly articulates how it will indirectly add value to the Cardano ecosystem by global lottery and hence promoting ADA adoption. But with just connecting the entire globe with an ADA lottery and using ADA-pay are not enough for user knowing about the Cardano platform and its ecosystem. It's better if the proposer could import the introduction or knowledge of Cardano or link with a game in which enthusiast engage acknowledge about Cardano.
The global lottery is a too vast and far away goal if the proposal has no good step-by-step strategy such as ADA-integrated into a local or a national lottery first. I hope to see this proposal with developing step in each next Funds.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer provides link of Lottery Widgets for evidence of background in lottery applications but not give out any reference link of relevant skills and experience needed to work with Cardano platform connection. To get success on this proposal, it needs a strong enough team with many members in some fields such as: PAB, Cardano DApp,...
The budget is just $8000 in common. The Author need to outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items such as: pay hire salary for DApp integration for a month, budget for marketing,... This requested funds is very vague and not details for assessing reasonable or not but it seems not enough for the global lottery targeted. The proposal also not offer a realistic timetable and a sensible and conductible plan to complete the work.
Additionally, the technical aspects that need to use to connect its frontend website with the backend of Cardano platform.
The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation such as: the security and anti-phishing for his website,... and how to mitigate these threats.
In shortly, I doubt about its feasibility and hope the proposer will well finalized in next Funds.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no roadmap, milestones and a time horizon for achievement. If could, the proposer need to provide a clear roadmap with works and achieved metrics/KPIs for each month, such as: how many users approach and engage in each local market in each milestone so that the community could follow and assess its sucess.

f6_assessments.q0: I think this proposal is submitted to the wrong challenge since wants to apply ADA to the lottery system of  some countries, while the challenge is Multilingual Resources. Therefore I rate 1 for its impact.
f6_assessments.q1: I think this proposal is submitted to the wrong challenge since wants to apply ADA to the lottery system of  some countries, while the challenge is Multilingual Resources. Therefore I rate 1 for its impact.
f6_assessments.q2: Since the proposal is off challenge, and it has not been written completely with developing plan, budget, team, resources, timeline - I strongly disagree that this challenge will be implemented successfully.

solution: Connecting the entire globe with an ADA lottery where say addresses that start with an alphanumeric sequence are awarded the dividens.
experience: Having worked with lottery applications - the strategy would be to use adapay for purchasing lottery tickets and building a site for users.
